Summary: My BFF flew in from Chicago for a girls weekend and some beautiful California sunshine and beach! We absolutely loved the Grotto! Perfect for the two of us. Bed was so comfy and we really enjoyed relaxing in the courtyard! Located right across the street from the beach, we couldn’t have asked for a more beautiful and relaxing weekend! Can’t wait to go back!!

Where to begin. In December, through Hotels.com, I made a reservation for this hotel. Unfortunately, I accidentally made the reservation for 02/23 as opposed to 12/23. This would normally not be an issue, but this particular reservation was not revisable. I immediately recognized my mistake and reached out to Hotels.com, who told me that I would have to speak directly with the hotel. I called and emailed the hotel and spoke to a woman at the desk who took mercy on my plight. While there were no more available rooms for 12/23, she assured me that they would refund my money. I told her that I appreciated her understanding and her Christmas spirit. Adding that as educators, lost money was particularly impactful. A few days passed, and I noticed that the reservation had not been
Manager Response: Hi Steven,  Thank you for your time posting this review. It's been brought to my attention that we have two different posting for Tripadivors, so I'm just now seeing your comments. Our records shows that we reached out to Hotels.com/Expedia to request your cancellation and refund and was told that you needed to contact them as well to confirm the cancellation since this was a non-refundable reservation. Via email, I relayed this information to you along with the phone number to complete your request. I also followed through with Hotels.com/Expedia later that day to make sure your request was granted, and was told that they left you a message and was waiting to hear from you. At that point,  I left you a voicemail with instruction to contact Hotels.com/Expedia to get your refund. Honestly, I don't remember the outcome or if you followed through on your end. However,  I understand mistakes happens and I know that I genuinely did my best to assist with your situation. I've been working in hospitality for the past 15 years and feel very passionate about serving others with exceptional customer service, and I must say that I'm beyond disappointed and disheartened over this review. I would be happy to talk with you again should you ever be in the area or planning a trip to San Clemente. Thanks again for your time! Kind regards, Lora aka woman at the desk

Summary Heading: Such a beautiful and cute place
Summary: I recently took my husband away for his birthday getaway and the place is phenomenal, clean, unique and just perfect. Karen and John made sure we are well taken care of for the stay. We will go back very soon. Sarab A.

We had initially rented an Airbnb which turned out to be disastrous (jackhammers next door, no air con, overpriced...) so when I found Oceanfront Hacienda while talking a morning walk I was delighted!  We stayed in the big studio on the top floor and I must say that the attention to details makes this place really special.  The decor is really thought out -- you really feel like you're in an authentic hacienda! -- from the cozy leather couches, big wooden table, bedding, curtains, dark wood furniture... It's honestly a superb room.  Considering how much we were paying for a crappy Airbnb this place if a FIND and super affordable.   The place was quiet, safe, you'll have a gorgeous view from your balcony.  Highly recommend it.
Room tip: Great view, great neighborhood, fantastic quality.

Summary: My family and I stayed in the back units for a few days while travelling through California on vacation.  I have to admit that I was a little nervous about staying here.  Booking a place sight unseen is always a little risky, but now that I have stayed here, I plan on coming back over and over again.  I can’t say enough about this place.  My family and I loved this place for so many reasons.  First off, the property is beautiful and well maintained.  According to the owner’s website, the buildings were built in 1928.  The timber framing, solid plaster walls, and antique fixtures make this place far more interesting and unique compared to any of the other places nearby.  I couldn’t help but feel the history as I made my way about the property.  From time to time I could hear the

My boyfriend, Doug, and I have stayed here several times over the last year. It has become our favorite landing place when we are in Orange County. The rooms have ocean views and are a 3-minute walk to the surf. The units are clean, comfortable and charmingly styled in a Spanish style. The outdoor areas are lovely - with fountains, plants, comfortable seats and views. The owner/managers, John and Karen, are friendly, attentive and meticulous caretakers. I can’t think of anything to gripe about. The closest I can come to a complaint is that the coffee makers provided in the rooms are modern and nice, but make weak coffee (we like it really strong). Fortunately, there is a great coffee shop a few steps from the front entrance. A superb experience all around!

Perfect place to stay in San Clemente.  The Patio with table and lounge chairs was excellent for relaxing in the sun.  Then just walk across the street and you are at the pier, beach and walking path. The units have everything you need to enjoy a relaxing vacation.

Summary Heading: The Perfect Place to stay in San Clemente
Summary: Not just a perfect location.  The property has been lovingly restored to its original glory as one of the early Ole Hansen properties in San Clemente by John and Karen who live on the property.  They couldn't be more friendly and helpful.  The back apartment has a stunning view of the ocean and pier and is quiet, very comfortable and very well equipped with everything we needed for a 6 week stay.  We were so impressed we booked for 2018 before we left.

Summary Heading: Small, but as they say Location, Location, Location
Summary: Located right across the street from the San Clemente pier,  The location can't be beat. Nice accommodations and nice staff.  The second floor has a long balcony with table, lounges, BBQ and Mexican Fire pot (Small stand alone fireplace).

This is a authentic and beautifully restored 1920s oceanfront hacienda.Its also the best spot to stay and feel comfortably at home. Karen and John live in front and thankfully choose to open three smaller casita type accommodations. Each has its own ocean views  patios and special touches while remaining private. While the hacienda looks inviting from the street - it just gets better as you enter the inner courtyard.....lots of specialness. Waves can be heard from everywhere - relax anywhere inside the compound or walk across the street to six miles of beach, the San Clemente beach walk, the magnificent pier, two perfect places to eat or drink at La Gallete or Pierside, or stroll uptown for even more great cafes. Somehow? All of this is still a mostly quiet and peaceful beach

Main plus here:  location -RIGHT across from pier!  Fabulous!  Owner nice. Now for the Lodging itself:  so-so.  Clean, slightly musty smelling.  Bed not terribly comfortable.  On street parking only -can be a problem.  So:  go for the view, don't spend a lot of time on the room.

Just had to mention this beautiful, unique property in South Orange County. It's really two different venues--by day it's the epicenter of the local surf and beach crowd, while after sunset everyone moves elsewhere and the entire area is quiet save the whooshing of the ocean or the train rumbling by. Literally steps from the Pacific and every view is stunning. Each room in this 1928 Spanish-style complex has its own look and feel, heavy wood tones and white stucco. The renovation was complete a couple weeks ago and every room has modern bathrooms, kitchens, and full cable TV. Two or three breakfast places next door and a decent restaurant out on the pier, which it also overlooks. The place is owned and managed by the couple who runs it, and, yes, they live there too. Well worth

Cannot say enough about this gorgeous, family owned and operated property. Seconds to walk to the beach. Full kitchen to prepare your own meals, or walk to the many restaurant options. Beds were extremely comfortable, with lovely linens. A beautiful fireplace with wood provided! And the views! Dining, living, kitchen, and bedroom have incredible ocean and palm tree views. We stayed in the back apartment and had plenty of room (one adult and two children). You could easily sleep 4 or 5. Karen and John were amazing hosts! The privacy and overall vibe left us feeling this was our "home" during our stay. We will be back year after year! Also, we didn't even need to rent a car. You can walk to shopping, restaurants and everything else with ease! Love love love this place!

I just stayed here with my fiancé and restoration is definitely complete...I didn't see any scaffolding or anything...what I did see was a beautiful beachfront hotel that has a lot of rustic charm.   The wifi was great and the location was perfect!  I could walk just Cross the street to the beach.   There is a train that goes by, but anything this close to the beach in San Clemente can hear it.    My fiancé and I were very satisfied with our stay and the customer service we experienced.

Horrible! Children booked what they thought was a wonderful hotel based on pics! Got their and room had holes in the walls, closet was a stairway up to another apartment with a clothes bar! Scaffolding all over the front! Should definitely not be renting while renovating! Especially trying to charge 200.00 a night for room! Got our money back and went to hotel down the street!
Manager Response: Sorry about your first impression of the Hacienda.  I think you should return at a later date and I’ll tell you why.  We are in the middle of a 2 year restoration right now.  We contemplated renting our rooms during the restoration.  As we got started about a year ago, the people who stayed with us showed us their appreciation for restoring this very special historical building back to its original state.  Also, we have noticed that most everybody so far has been very patient and some have returned during the work being done here.  With that said, let me get to the actual complaint now.  Because of repiping and installation of heat ducts, we were forced to open up the walls in some areas.  Well for the most part we have been keeping up with the wall patches.  We couldn’t get those ones done in time before you got there.  I should have covered those up with paper or something before you got there.  Sorry, my fault.  Yes, you are right the closet for that room is at the bottom of a stairwell that doesn’t get used now.  We will make an adjustment for this soon.  As for the scaffolding, yes, it is all around the building right now because we are resurfacing the exterior of the building completely.  The scaffolding will be down soon.  All of these things are part of our restoration and we are very excited about it.  I don’t know what you are talking about in regards to the room rate.  We charge $125/night plus tax for this time of year during the week (Sunday-Thursday).  Karen did refund your money as she said she would.    We always tell everybody when they make their reservations that the restoration is going on and where we are with it in and around the room that the person will be staying in, but when you made the reservation we hadn’t started the work on that room yet, and when we found out that the work in that room wouldn’t be finished, we called you in advance to let you know, in order to give you the option of cancelling the reservation if you wanted to.  Your daughter said to keep the reservation.  John R Gabay III
